email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk ze2 branch testing
email.body:
well, after falling over the bison problem..
it appears that $HTTP_SERVER_VARS is broken in ZE2 at present so I hacked that to $_SERVER[] - seemed ok.
the build I ran this morning halted at php_gtk_object.c:807 'gtk_object_ce' undeclared (first use of this funciton)
that was building with ./configure --enable-pixmap --enable-scintilla
Regards Alan

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] win32 distribution install instructions and tree
email.body:
On Tue, Jan 21, 2003 at 01:05:22AM +0800, firepage wrote : > Hi, a quick rant about the current suggested installation for win32. > > I think that suggesting users copy all the dll's to the system dir and worse > still the php.ini to the windir is asking for trouble, most win32 users > interested in php-gtk already have mod_php setup on thier system and > overwriting the php.ini is a recipie for cursing. > > Why cant the suggested installation just dump all dll's in the /php4 > directory and extensions in /php4/extensions making sure that both php.exe > and php_win.exe look first in /php4 for the php.ini. > > There may be a good reason that this is not the case, but I can't see it as > your win32 typical user , it almost seems designed to annoy and confuse ... > user installs mod_php - it works - user installs php-gtk - mod_php is > stuffed > bad juju IMO ;)
I'm seconding this. IMHO it's really a mess to copy it all to %SYSTEM% and you're right, it works all fine from a custom PHP direcotry. Maybe there are issues on W95/98 ?
Also I think users may having trouble adjusting their %PATH% variable so they can call and execute their php-gtk binary from everywhere ... ?
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] I got bored..
email.body:
After getting rid of the reference to 'gtkgdkpixmap.c' completely, overriding gdk_pixbuf_new_from_file() with an 'ignore', commenting out PixbufFrameAction enums in the defs, and statically linking to a gdkpixbuf lib I'm down to just unresolved external symbols.
There are two libs created when gdkpixbuf is built (I could of course be using a wrong version). The only difference in output is that the one marked static (s version) notes a MSCVRT.dll conflict.
(Andrei, did you get anywhere with this or have you been too busy?)

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: GtkScintilla on Win32
email.body:
I added the dll to the PHPGTK extentions in php.ini and copied to dll to where my php.exe is and got it loaded etc etc. However whenI try and create a new scintilla widget I get these errors:
(process:1736): GLib-CRITICAL **: file ghash.c: line <line_num> (g_hash_table_lookup): assertion `hash_table != NULL' failed
Where <line_num> is 225 or 291. The error is repeated many times. I also get:
(process:1736): Gtk-WARNING **: gtk_type_create(): unknown parent type `21'.
As well as many other errors.
The code I used to create a widget is:
$scintilla=new GtkScintilla();
Im guessing its an internal problem?
Frank M. Kromann wrote:
> Hi,
> I have just committed changes needed toi build the GtkScintilla extension > on WIn32. The dll can be downloaded from http://kromann.info/php4.php.
> The extension will be included in the next release of PHP-GTK.
> - Frank
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] win32 distribution install instructions and tree
email.body:
Hi, a quick rant about the current suggested installation for win32.
I think that suggesting users copy all the dll's to the system dir and worse still the php.ini to the windir is asking for trouble, most win32 users interested in php-gtk already have mod_php setup on thier system and overwriting the php.ini is a recipie for cursing.
Why cant the suggested installation just dump all dll's in the /php4 directory and extensions in /php4/extensions making sure that both php.exe and php_win.exe look first in /php4 for the php.ini.
There may be a good reason that this is not the case, but I can't see it as your win32 typical user , it almost seems designed to annoy and confuse ... user installs mod_php - it works - user installs php-gtk - mod_php is stuffed bad juju IMO ;)
So whats the chance of a change ?
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 - please test build - Instructions to
email.body:
> Alan, > > Gtk2 may require a bit of a different approach in the way objects are > constructed and so on. Doing it straight on, similar to Gtk1 won't let > us take advantage of optimizations and extendibility features. I plan to > sit down and write up a plan of attack before PHP Con..
That should be feasible - not much of the current code has been altered much, so far: - added gobject to the inheritence tree - fleshed out signal connect with closures. - got my h2defs.php to parse all .h files from gtk2 perfectly(I hope). - added xxx.defs.defaults (to set defaults) - moved xxx.defs.extra (for additional defs not generated from headers) - commented out GtkArgs->php args code.
Looking at the general requirements for Gtk2 -
a) defs file creation / overrides b) signals/callbacks + GtkArg->GValue conversions c) changing the base code to use GObject, rather than GtkObject. (and ?? examine how the objects/ze store stuff works)
I was tempted to leave the last bit alone for the moment anyway.. - The idea being it's nice to have a working testbed for any new Object design..
I was thinking of maybe attacking b) depending on timescale - I didnt think there was too much overlap in those areas.. eg. changing the object model may not affect too much of the existing code anyway..?
Regards Alan
> > -Andrei > > I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by. > -- Douglas Adams >
-- Can you help out? Need Consulting Services or Know of a Job? http://www.akbkhome.com
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] RV: Using GtkExtra under phpgtk
email.body:
I have send this to the general list, excuse me...
-----Mensaje original----- De: Angel Maza Enviado el: martes, 06 de mayo de 2003 8:58 Para: php-gtk-general@lists.php.net Asunto: Using GtkExtra under phpgtk
I'm starting to create plot.defs for making a GtkPlot/Canvas class...
;; -*- scheme -*- ; object definitions ...
(object Plot (in-module Gtk) (parent Widget (Gtk)) (c-name GtkPlot) ) (object Canvas (in-module Gtk) (parent Widget (Gtk)) (c-name GtkCanvas) )
(function gtk_plot_canvas_new (c-name gtk_plot_canvas_new) (is-constructor-of GtkCanvas) (return-type GtkWidget*) (parameter (type-and-name gint width)) (parameter (type-and-name gint height)) (parameter (type-and-name gdouble magnification))
) (function gtk_plot_new_with_size (c-name gtk_plot_new_with_size) (is-constructor-of GtkPlot) (return-type GtkWidget*) (parameter (type-and-name GdkDrawable* drawable)) (parameter (type-and-name gdouble width)) (parameter (type-and-name gdouble height)) )
With the canvas all is ok, I draw it in the window. But with plot I have the next problem. In C, gtk_plot_new_with_size is called using a NULL as GdkDrawable, but in PHP I can't send it a Null, it claims a GtkDrawable widget.
Best Regards. Angel Maza.
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 - signals, glade
email.body:
Hello!
I need working php-gtk2 with glade2 "for yesterday" :) I've done some work on porting. The result is on: http://ggodlewski.host.sk/php-gtk-0.5.2.tar.gz
I've used defs files from pygtk and modified generator. It's done "quick&dirty way" so defs have to be regenerated (I've removed non-working functions). All the modifications in main/* and php_gtk+-types.c should be extended - new classes aren't fully implemented, some things are just commented.
It even works... However the signals handling has changed in gtk2 (so it doesn't work). Glade2 doesn't work also. It shows message:
PHP Fatal error: Underlying object missing or of invalid type in ... Memory Fault
Could anyone tell me what does it mean? I would be very grateful if anybody help me fixing this two things. It's very urgent for me.

Devels, tell me what i have to do :P

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Patch for GdkWindow::(get|set)_decorations
email.body:
Hello, here's a patch against the sources from the 1.0.0 tarball to add the following two functions:
int GdkWindow::get_decorations(void) void GdkWindow::set_decorations(int decorations)
I could see from a grep that the constants needed (GDK_DECOR_*) are defined but the functions weren't.
Inside get_decorations(), the call to gdk_window_get_decorations() is if'ed as this function isn't defined on my system (see below [1]), issuing the message '/usr/libexec/ld-elf.so.1: /usr/ports/x11-toolkits/php-gtk/work/php-gtk-1.0.0/modules/php_gtk.so: Undefined symbol "gdk_window_get_decorations"'. I'm not sure if #if is correct (is there a define in GTK-versions with it?). It seems though from a search on Google that this function exists in some versions, therefor I added this functionality. The function returns FALSE in case gdk_window_get_decorations doesn't exist (maybe there should be a warning?).
For the manual: ---------------------------------------------------------------------- GdkWindow::set_decorations() tries to set the decorations of a window. The decorations argument is the logical OR of the fields in the GdkWMDecoration enumeration. If GDK_DECOR_ALL is included in the mask, the other bits indicate which decorations should be turned off. If GDK_DECOR_ALL is not included, then the other bits indicate which decorations should be turned on.
These are hints originally defined by the Motif toolkit. The window manager can use them when determining how to decorate the window. The hint must be set before mapping the window. GDK_DECOR_ALL all decorations should be applied. GDK_DECOR_BORDER a frame should be drawn around the window. GDK_DECOR_RESIZEH the frame should have resize handles. GDK_DECOR_TITLE a titlebar should be placed above the window. GDK_DECOR_MENU a button for opening a menu should be included. GDK_DECOR_MINIMIZE a minimize button should be included. GDK_DECOR_MAXIMIZE a maximize button should be included.
Note: This function needs to be called prior to the window being shown but after it has been realized (a GdkWindow is associated with the GtkWindow). ----------------------------------------------------------------------
[1] System information: $ uname -a FreeBSD friebes.net 4.8-STABLE FreeBSD 4.8-STABLE #9: Thu Aug 7 21:39:07 CEST 2003 root@friebes.net:/usr/obj/usr/src/sys/GENERIC i386
$ gtk12-config --version 1.2.10
$ grep -Hrn 'decor' /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/* /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/gdk/gdk.h:378:void gdk_window_set_decorations (GdkWindow *window, /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/gdk/gdk.h:379: GdkWMDecoration decorations); /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/gdk/gdktypes.h:670: * of gdk_window_set_decorations/gdk_window_set_functions
Please include me in any replies, I'm not subscribed to php-gtk-dev.
- Timm
["php_gtk_decorations.patch" (php_gtk_decorations.patch)]
--- ext/gtk+/php_gtk+_types.c Fri Oct 10 19:03:07 2003 +++ /home/thekid/php_gtk+_types.c Sun Dec 21 17:39:49 2003 @@ -600,6 +600,29 @@ src_window, src_x, src_y, width, height); }
+PHP_FUNCTION(gdk_window_set_decorations) +{ + GdkWMDecoration decorations; + NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); + + if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "i", &decorations)) + return; + + gdk_window_set_decorations(PHP_GDK_WINDOW_GET(this_ptr), decorations); +} + +PHP_FUNCTION(gdk_window_get_decorations) +{ + GdkWMDecoration decorations; + +#if gdk_window_get_decorations + gdk_window_get_decorations(PHP_GDK_WINDOW_GET(this_ptr), &decorations); + RETURN_LONG(decorations); +#else + RETURN_FALSE; +#endif +} + static function_entry php_gdk_window_functions[] = { {"GdkWindow", PHP_FN(no_direct_constructor), NULL}, {"gdkwindow", PHP_FN(no_direct_constructor), NULL}, @@ -613,6 +636,8 @@ {"property_delete", PHP_FN(gdk_window_property_delete), NULL}, {"set_icon", PHP_FN(gdk_window_set_icon), NULL}, {"copy_area", PHP_FN(gdk_window_copy_area), NULL}, + {"set_decorations", PHP_FN(gdk_window_set_decorations), NULL}, + {"get_decorations", PHP_FN(gdk_window_get_decorations), NULL}, {NULL, NULL, NULL} };
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] dealing with object->array[values]
email.body:
Andrei,
Just spent some time looking at the way the engine could handle our $gtkstyle->fg[XXX] = ... code.
It appears that it expects you to generate a object for fg, then add a dimension_read/write handler for it.
Now comes the thought.. what should this magic object be: a extension/copy of gtkstyle, with some magic flag set for the 'fg' bit somewhere? or should it just store the fg bit of the gtkstyle struct (which will get very messy with referecing/allocation...)
I started (read not alot) hacking it up as GtkStyleArray (without a constructor.. etc. )
Thoughts..
Regards Alan
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: dealing with object->array[values]

- Andrei

ID: 26388 Comment by: k dot dambekalns at fishfarm dot de Reported By: dbellizz at angmar dot com Status: Wont fix Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Operating System: Slackware 9.1 PHP Version: Irrelevant New Comment:
This comment from http://gtk.php.net/manual/en/installunix.php helps (autoconf 2.58 used): ---- snip ---- Simple solution to PHP_GTK_ARG_ENABLE problem detailed below. This must be added to this page and the README, please oh please!
./buildconf aclocal ./buildconf (again!) ./configure make make install
I also needed to make the following change to my php.ini: extension_dir = /usr/local/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20020429/
Once that was in place, the tests ran beautifully! ---- snip ----
Karsten

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #26679 [NEW]: php error messages in c files
email.body:
From: vpupkin at comcast dot net Operating system: Linux PHP version: Irrelevant PHP Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Bug description: php error messages in c files Description: ------------ to reproduce (php-gtk-1.0.0) $./buildconf $./configure ... ./configure: line 3665: syntax error near unexpected token `debug,' ./configure: line 3665: `PHP_GTK_ARG_ENABLE(debug, whether to include debugging symbols,' $aclocal $./buildconf $./configure $make files: /ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c contains (it's inside the file): br /> Warning: fopen(--): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 110

Warning: fgets(): supplied argument is not a valid stream resource in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 34
/ext/gtk+/get_gdk.c contains:
Warning: filemtime(): Stat failed for -- (errno=2 - No such file or directory) in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 101
you can remove those line from the files and do "make" (it will go a bit farther) again, but then you receive the folliwing: /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c: In function `php_gtk_arg_from_value': /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: `gtk_object_ce' undeclared (first use in this function) /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: for each function it appears in.) /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c: In function `php_gtk_ret_from_value': /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:892: error: `gtk_object_ce' undeclared (first use in this function) make: *** [main/php_gtk_object.lo] Error 1 Hope it helps. Thanks Alexander Kabanov -- Edit bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=26679&edit=1 -- Try a CVS snapshot (php4): http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=trysnapshot4 Try a CVS snapshot (php5): http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=trysnapshot5 Fixed in CVS: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=fixedcvs Fixed in release: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=alreadyfixed Need backtrace: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=needtrace Need Reproduce Script: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=needscript Try newer version: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=oldversion Not developer issue: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=support Expected behavior: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=notwrong Not enough info: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=notenoughinfo Submitted twice: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=submittedtwice register_globals: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=globals PHP 3 support discontinued: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=php3 Daylight Savings: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=dst IIS Stability: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=isapi Install GNU Sed: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=gnused Floating point limitations: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26679&r=float -- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

If > GDK_DECOR_ALL is not included, then the other bits indicate which > decorations should be turned on. > > These are hints originally defined by the Motif toolkit. The window > manager can use them when determining how to decorate the window. The > hint must be set before mapping the window. > GDK_DECOR_ALL all decorations should be applied. > GDK_DECOR_BORDER a frame should be drawn around the window. > GDK_DECOR_RESIZEH the frame should have resize handles. > GDK_DECOR_TITLE a titlebar should be placed above the window. > GDK_DECOR_MENU a button for opening a menu should be included. > GDK_DECOR_MINIMIZE a minimize button should be included. > GDK_DECOR_MAXIMIZE a maximize button should be included. > > Note: This function needs to be called prior to the window being shown > but after it has been realized (a GdkWindow is associated with the > GtkWindow). > ---------------------------------------------------------------------- > > [1] System information: > $ uname -a > FreeBSD friebes.net 4.8-STABLE FreeBSD 4.8-STABLE #9: Thu Aug 7 > 21:39:07 CEST 2003 root@friebes.net:/usr/obj/usr/src/sys/GENERIC > i386 > > $ gtk12-config --version > 1.2.10 > > $ grep -Hrn 'decor' /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/* > /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/gdk/gdk.h:378:void > gdk_window_set_decorations (GdkWindow *window, > /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/gdk/gdk.h:379: \ > GdkWMDecoration decorations); > /usr/X11R6/include/gtk12/gdk/gdktypes.h:670: * of > gdk_window_set_decorations/gdk_window_set_functions > > Please include me in any replies, I'm not subscribed to php-gtk-dev. > > - Timm > > > ------------------------------------------------------------------------ > > --- ext/gtk+/php_gtk+_types.c Fri Oct 10 19:03:07 2003 > +++ /home/thekid/php_gtk+_types.c Sun Dec 21 17:39:49 2003 > @@ -600,6 +600,29 @@ > src_window, src_x, src_y, width, height); > } > > +PHP_FUNCTION(gdk_window_set_decorations) > +{ > + GdkWMDecoration decorations; > + NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > + > + if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "i", &decorations)) > + return; > + > + gdk_window_set_decorations(PHP_GDK_WINDOW_GET(this_ptr), decorations); > +} > + > +PHP_FUNCTION(gdk_window_get_decorations) > +{ > + GdkWMDecoration decorations; > + > +#if gdk_window_get_decorations > + gdk_window_get_decorations(PHP_GDK_WINDOW_GET(this_ptr), &decorations); > + RETURN_LONG(decorations); > +#else > + RETURN_FALSE; > +#endif > +} > + > static function_entry php_gdk_window_functions[] = { > {"GdkWindow", PHP_FN(no_direct_constructor), NULL}, > {"gdkwindow", PHP_FN(no_direct_constructor), NULL}, > @@ -613,6 +636,8 @@ > {"property_delete", PHP_FN(gdk_window_property_delete), NULL}, > {"set_icon", PHP_FN(gdk_window_set_icon), NULL}, > {"copy_area", PHP_FN(gdk_window_copy_area), NULL}, > + {"set_decorations", PHP_FN(gdk_window_set_decorations), NULL}, > + {"get_decorations", PHP_FN(gdk_window_get_decorations), NULL}, > {NULL, NULL, NULL} > }; > > >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #26067 [NEW]: node_get_cell_style doesn't work
email.body:
From: cweiske at cweiske dot de Operating system: windows xp PHP version: 4.3.3 PHP Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Bug description: node_get_cell_style doesn't work
Description: ------------ The "node_get_cell_style" of the GtkCTree widget does not work, it just returns NULL. The same problem should apply to the GtkCList.
Reproduce code: --------------- <?php dl( "php_gtk." . ( strstr( PHP_OS, "WIN") ? "dll" : "so")); function delete_event() { return false; } function destroy() { Gtk::main_quit(); } $window = &new GtkWindow(); $window->set_default_size( 200, 200); $window->connect('destroy', 'destroy'); $window->connect('delete-event', 'delete_event'); $tree = &new GtkCTree( 1, 0, array( "Style")); $window->add( $tree); $window->show_all();
$node = $tree->insert_node( null, null, array( "Text"), 5, null, null, null, null, false, false); $nodestyle = $tree->node_get_cell_style( $node, 0); print_r( $nodestyle);//should be NOT null $col1 = &new GdkColor(0, 56000, 0); $nodestyle->base[GTK_STATE_NORMAL] = $col1; $tree->node_set_cell_style( $node, 0, $nodestyle); Gtk::main(); ?>
Expected result: ---------------- the cell style of the first tree cell should have a nice color
-- Edit bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=26067&edit=1 -- Try a CVS snapshot (php4): http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=trysnapshot4 Try a CVS snapshot (php5): http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=trysnapshot5 Fixed in CVS: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=fixedcvs Fixed in release: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=alreadyfixed Need backtrace: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=needtrace Try newer version: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=oldversion Not developer issue: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=support Expected behavior: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=notwrong Not enough info: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=notenoughinfo Submitted twice: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=submittedtwice register_globals: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=globals PHP 3 support discontinued: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=php3 Daylight Savings: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=dst IIS Stability: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=isapi Install GNU Sed: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=gnused Floating point limitations: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26067&r=float

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] php-gtk file extension
email.body:
[I think what we need is a php-gtk install and configuration tool (written in php-gtk).]
That would be ideal
But I don't see that negates the need for a standard extension regardless , e.g. I have an nsis based php-gtk installer (2 of them in fact (deployed over 80,000 x to date ) and I know that there are other such installers , it would be nice (and less confusing for total noobs) if my installer used the same extensions as everybody else's installer .
Now I don't care who's installer peeps (and an official gtk.php.net version would be ideal) use as long as it gets them interested in php-gtk , the current set-up is not good for mainstream win32 users in that I know many otherwise 'experienced' users who get totally confused trying to start a php-gtk application , even the samples that ship and basically just give up before they get hooked , providing standard registry entries to allow point-and-click covers this immediately.
[Check to see if php and php-gtk are installed. If not download and install them.]
Something you can't do on win32 unless you have some standard method of saying 'php-gtk is installed' , e.g. a known registry key or a known php-gtk.ini file sitting somewhere one may expect to find it.
[And the thing with "using dos screens" does nothing have to do with php-gtk, this would be a normal script. I'd propose the context menu "open in dosbox", available to all php-gtk scripts. This would it make easy to debug them if needed but requires no changes to the extension.]
I use php-gtk apps in distinctly different ways which is how I got there in the first place though I take your point.
So regardless of what may happen in the future with a totally php-gtk based installer whets wrong with a couple of standards now? 1) file extension (s) 2) registry entries ala HKLM/Software/php-gtk [install_dir (x:/wherever)]
Like Steph and probably most here I will still mostly use .php files for myself .. but when I deploy (on others machines) I HAVE to give an extension ... I would rather it be one that everyone agrees with.
I am finished up phpdev5 now which is more server-oriented and for total noobs , but its going to end up on a lot of machines ... with php-gtk as the 'installer' but still requiring nsis (or similar ) to deploy , it will leave php-gtk on the users machine (sharing as many extensions/dll's as possible) and to date I was going to set the pgtk and dgtk extensions for php-gtk apps ... but as I said before I don't care a kippers what they are called , but it would be nice to use something that everyone was happy with cos I like happy people.
... I think we have run out of useful 3 letter extensions bar rude words which are much better expressed with 4 anyway ;)
Regards, Simon.
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #26164 [NEW]: build-error in generator/scheme.php
email.body:
From: mike dot greubel at pro-entertain dot de Operating system: Linux PHP version: 4.3.3 PHP Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Bug description: build-error in generator/scheme.php
Description: ------------ After times of trying to compile php-gtk I learned, that generator/scheme.php has an error on line 101 (filemtime). In my php (in fact all versions I tried) 4.3.3 only works filemtime with full path to the file I want to check. So I patched scheme parameter to
> Line 101: Add $current_dir = getcwd(); $cache_file = "$current_dir/$defs_file.cache";
Now the cachefile is found. But there's a check for $defs_file, too. This file is definitly not on my system. I tried in php-gtk-directory:
find -name -- and find -name "\-\-"
- no results.
There's no chance for me to compile it?
Greetings Mike
-- Edit bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=26164&edit=1 -- Try a CVS snapshot (php4): http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=trysnapshot4 Try a CVS snapshot (php5): http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=trysnapshot5 Fixed in CVS: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=fixedcvs Fixed in release: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=alreadyfixed Need backtrace: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=needtrace Try newer version: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=oldversion Not developer issue: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=support Expected behavior: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=notwrong Not enough info: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=notenoughinfo Submitted twice: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=submittedtwice register_globals: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=globals PHP 3 support discontinued: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=php3 Daylight Savings: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=dst IIS Stability: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=isapi Install GNU Sed: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=gnused Floating point limitations: http://bugs.php.net/fix.php?id=26164&r=float

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] gtkhtml won't compile on 1.0.0 (patch attached)
email.body:
HI all I discovered that gtkhtml extension won't compile with php-gtk-1.0.0.tar.gz so I read and a made the patch attached
bye alx
["php-gtk-1.0.0-ext-gtkhtml.patch" (php-gtk-1.0.0-ext-gtkhtml.patch)]
diff -uar old/php-gtk-1.0.0/ext/gtkhtml/gtkhtml.defs new/php-gtk-1.0.0/ext/gtkhtml/gtkhtml.defs --- old/php-gtk-1.0.0/ext/gtkhtml/gtkhtml.defs 2003-10-10 10:52:36.000000000 +0200 +++ new/php-gtk-1.0.0/ext/gtkhtml/gtkhtml.defs 2003-11-25 02:25:57.000000000 +0100 @@ -348,6 +348,7 @@ (parameter (type-and-name GdkAtom selection)) (parameter (type-and-name gint type)) (parameter (type-and-name gint32 time)) + (parameter (type-and-name gboolean as_cite)) )
;; Loading @@ -514,7 +515,7 @@ (of-object HTML (Gtk)) (c-name gtk_html_set_indent) (return-type none) - (parameter (type-and-name gint level)) + (parameter (type-and-name gint* level)) )
(method modify_indent_by_delta @@ -574,6 +575,7 @@ (of-object HTML (Gtk)) (c-name gtk_html_paste) (return-type none) + (parameter (type-and-name gboolean as_cite)) ) (method undo (of-object HTML (Gtk)) @@ -690,14 +692,14 @@ (c-name gtk_html_get_font_color) (return-type GdkColor) ) - -(method set_cursor_xy - (of-object HTML (Gtk)) - (c-name gtk_html_set_cursor_xy) - (return-type none) - (parameter (type-and-name gint x)) - (parameter (type-and-name gint y)) -) +; don't work now +;(method set_cursor_xy +; (of-object HTML (Gtk)) +; (c-name gtk_html_set_cursor_xy) +; (return-type none) +; (parameter (type-and-name gint x)) +; (parameter (type-and-name gint y)) +;)
; links !
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: gtkhtml won't compile on 1.0.0 (patch attached)
email.body:
They are in CVS, as http://cvs.php.net/co.php/php-gtk/ext/gtkhtml/Attic/gtkhtml.overrides_for_gtkhtml.1.1?sa=1&r=1.1.2.1 http://cvs.php.net/co.php/php-gtk/ext/gtkhtml/Attic/gtkhtml.defs_for_gtkhtml.1.1?sa=1&r=1.1.2.1
as the note says, since GTK1 is kind of depreciated, there isnt a real 'good' solution for this.
Big Problem is that some distributions distribute Gtkhtml1.1, others only Gtkhtml1.0 - and they are not compatible...
Hopefully the 2 patches already sent to the mailing list + the rather hidden away references in CVS will help others...
Regards Alan

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] A big delay on a remote machine
email.body:
Madeleine,
To launch my application I use at this time both php.exe or php_win.exe. I move this two files locally and there is no more delay. There is no use to move locally your dll, they can stay on your server, still you have to update the php.ini and to put it in the good location locally. Of course now I guess that my application is running locally and I try to figure out a way to launch shell on my server (almost there)....
If you have any other questions....
Thanks, Kristel.

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #26468 [NEW]: php_win.exe failing to hide dos window
email.body:
From: loner at psknet dot com Operating system: Windows XP PHP version: 4.3.4 PHP Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Bug description: php_win.exe failing to hide dos window
Description: ------------ While running .5.2, I could use php to correctly hide the DOS window while running my program.
However, when I switched to 1.0.0, php_win no longer hides it. If it try to output something, EG, echo something, it still crashes/closes. I have all necessary .dlls and exe's in a directory under my scripts. (\backend) I find this easier than fully installing php.
My whole app (and the php files I use) can be extracted using this installer: http://www.vxgames.net/mr/downloads/TepAppSetup.exe
Expected result: ---------------- You don't need any special code, just run something normally and it won't hide it.
Actual result: -------------- Dos window is not hidden.

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] A big delay on a remote machine
email.body:
Hello,
Just to know if you have any idea on this:
I run my php-gtk program on my machine (1) and it takes max 2sec for my first window \ to appear. On an another machine(2), I mount a network drive on (1) and I run the \ same program, it takes at least 7sec for the window to appear. After that I have the \ same reaction time no matter that machine I am on. I first thougt it was the access \ to the database but I have the same difference with a simple example. I also try to \ relocate my dll files on (2) but it seems not to be the problem.
Is there a way to reduce this delay? What is php-gtk doing? is there a way I can find out?
Thanks for your help, Kristel

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest
email.body:
well, the "father" of PHP-GTK made an tutorial, just try to compile that codes without changes on the lastest version of PHP-GTK, you'll see that most (if not all) doesn't work if you don't change them. http://chico.benjamindsmith.com/article-php-gtk.html
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: RE: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest
email.body:
Markus is very good, but he's in no way the "father" of PHP-GTK.
The only problem I had with running _any_ of this stuff here (from version 0.0.1) was that the insert_text() function changed the amount of parameters it needed.
This change was made on 2001-05-05, when PHP-GTK was 2 months and 4 days old. You're seriously telling me you have an application that won't run because of this change?????
> -----Original Message----- > From: Turbano [mailto:thomasgm@ajato.com.br] > Sent: 30 November 2003 00:36 > To: php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest > > > well, the "father" of PHP-GTK made an tutorial, just try to compile that > codes without changes on the lastest version of PHP-GTK, you'll see that > most (if not all) doesn't work if you don't change them. > http://chico.benjamindsmith.com/article-php-gtk.html > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest
email.body:
Steph, i think you understand me wrong, but, i'm trying to tell is that if you get the lastest version (as all new guys will do) and try to search google or other locations for tutorials (cause nobody that are starting, start at the manual, you know :), that applications will not run :/. So i'm afraid that people that get php-gtk (not me, not you) get this great programming language, and get frustate because they can't compile their older applications or older codes that teach things, etc, etc. And we all know that manual will not cover everything for new programmers, so, i think that we need to make some kind of php-gtk that do things like delphi or c++ that you get codes from Delphi 1, and still can compile on delphi 6 or 7. I mean, people don't like to lost their codes because they are upgrading, just look at register_globals of PHP, they didn't remove that , they just disable in the newer versions, and will remove in version 5 of PHP i think this is a good thing to do.
-- Hopoe you understand my english and my message. Turbano
> Markus is very good, but he's in no way the "father" of PHP-GTK. > > The only problem I had with running _any_ of this stuff here (from version > 0.0.1) was that the insert_text() function changed the amount of parameters > it needed. > > This change was made on 2001-05-05, when PHP-GTK was 2 months and 4 days > old. You're seriously telling me you have an application that won't run > because of this change????? > > > -----Original Message----- > > From: Turbano [mailto:thomasgm@ajato.com.br] > > Sent: 30 November 2003 00:36 > > To: php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net > > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest > > > > > > well, the "father" of PHP-GTK made an tutorial, just try to compile that > > codes without changes on the lastest version of PHP-GTK, you'll see that > > most (if not all) doesn't work if you don't change them. > > http://chico.benjamindsmith.com/article-php-gtk.html > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >

email.subject: RE: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest
email.body:
Thomas,
I don't think that one function parameter change (ONE) dating from the beginning of the PHP-GTK project justifies this thread. Andrei's usually careful about BC, but that particular article - the original of which is no longer online - was the first item anyone put online about PHP-GTK. I know - I edited the article.
It would be easy enough to allow for a third optional parameter that does nothing, but there's no point in doing that if there's not a general problem and - put it this way, in 2.5 years you're the first person to mention that this might be a problem at all.
Where else have you found anything online that was written for earlier versions and actually won't run under PHP-GTK 1.0?
Steph
> -----Original Message----- > From: Turbano [mailto:thomasgm@ajato.com.br] > Sent: 30 November 2003 03:37 > To: steph.fox@virgin.net; php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest > > > Steph, i think you understand me wrong, but, i'm trying to tell is that if > you get the lastest version > (as all new guys will do) and try to search google or other locations for > tutorials (cause nobody that > are starting, start at the manual, you know :), that applications will not > run :/. So i'm afraid that people > that get php-gtk (not me, not you) get this great programming > language, and > get frustate because they > can't compile their older applications or older codes that teach things, > etc, etc. And we all know that > manual will not cover everything for new programmers, so, i think that we > need to make some kind of > php-gtk that do things like delphi or c++ that you get codes from > Delphi 1, > and still can compile on delphi 6 > or 7. I mean, people don't like to lost their codes because they are > upgrading, just look at register_globals of > PHP, they didn't remove that , they just disable in the newer > versions, and > will remove in version 5 of PHP > i think this is a good thing to do. > > -- > Hopoe you understand my english and my message. > Turbano > > > > Markus is very good, but he's in no way the "father" of PHP-GTK. > > > > The only problem I had with running _any_ of this stuff here > (from version > > 0.0.1) was that the insert_text() function changed the amount of > parameters > > it needed. > > > > This change was made on 2001-05-05, when PHP-GTK was 2 months and 4 days > > old. You're seriously telling me you have an application that won't run > > because of this change????? > > > > > -----Original Message----- > > > From: Turbano [mailto:thomasgm@ajato.com.br] > > > Sent: 30 November 2003 00:36 > > > To: php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net > > > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] re: manifest > > > > > > > > > well, the "father" of PHP-GTK made an tutorial, just try to > compile that > > > codes without changes on the lastest version of PHP-GTK, > you'll see that > > > most (if not all) doesn't work if you don't change them. > > > http://chico.benjamindsmith.com/article-php-gtk.html > > > > > > -- > > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > > > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] A big delay on a remote machine
email.body:
Ok sorry, I have my answer : I had to move on my machine (2) the files php_win.exe Thanks anyway. Kristel
----- Original Message ----- From: "Kristel Touron" <kristel.touron@windriver.com> To: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Wednesday, November 26, 2003 12:48 PM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] A big delay on a remote machine
Hello,
Just to know if you have any idea on this:
I run my php-gtk program on my machine (1) and it takes max 2sec for my first window to appear. On an another machine(2), I mount a network drive on (1) and I run the same program, it takes at least 7sec for the window to appear. After that I have the same reaction time no matter that machine I am on. I first thougt it was the access to the database but I have the same difference with a simple example. I also try to relocate my dll files on (2) but it seems not to be the problem.
Is there a way to reduce this delay? What is php-gtk doing? is there a way I can find out?
Thanks for your help, Kristel
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] My small resume
email.body:
The current php-gtk-ze2 code is at
http://devel.akbkhome.com/svn/index.php/php-gtk2-ze2/
A couple of things that can be done - generating defs files: This script takes .h files and generates them. http://devel.akbkhome.com/svn/index.php/akpear/PHP_CGenerator/h2def.php
It still needs a bit more work to generate the defs files for gtk2 - you could have a go at finishing that off
the resulting defs files are in http://devel.akbkhome.com/svn/index.php/php-gtk2-ze2/ext/gtk+/
- looking at gobject have a look through http://devel.akbkhome.com/svn/index.php/php-gtk2-ze2/main/php_gtk_object.c this needs to be reworked through to start with gobject, rather than gtkobject. and callbacks need to use the new GClosure structure
http://www.gnome.org/~james/language-bindings/
Let me know which bit you want to attack..
The svn stuff can be checked out from the link on the web page.
Regards Alan
Michael Vergoz wrote: > Hello, > let me introduce myself to you, > > My name is Michael VERGOZ and I live in France. > > > It there have 2 day ago I have be allot on the project Php-gtk > to allow the evolution of a technology more than intresting > because it allow with user no-inform to can create a graphic application > stable and portable. > > One can say that the current code is a _advanced_ proof-of-concept. > > I hope to succeed in making evolve this technology. > > I have a very varied knowledge : > - Language: > - C, C++, Asm x86, (some base in 68k), Flex, Yacc (bison), PHP (:P) > > - Linux/Unix: - > - Lib: ncurses, libpq, regex, GD, glut, pcap... > - System: IPC, Thread, blah... > - Kernel hacking > > - Darwin (not have Unix): > - Good concepts of portability > - Carbon, Cocao, and of another things APPLE depend, like the network API > > - Windows: > - WSA, APP, pixelformat, User Interface and another things... > > > Devels, tell me what i have to do :P > > Thanks, > Michael > descript@php.net >

> ps The syntax would be weird for gtk, but I don't know enough about > pango (never having used it) to know if that's related to your trouble. > > The font in GDK is described in XFLD format > http://gtk.php.net/manual/en/gdk.method.font_load.php > .. > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Zitan Broth" <zitan@mediasculpt.net> > To: <php-gtk-general@lists.php.net> > Sent: Friday, September 19, 2003 9:44 PM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK] GTk Related Question > > > > Greetings Again, > > > > Just thought I'd add this note in case anyway has a brainstorm about > the > > problem :-) > > > > Pango is actually erroring when I call it from the command line - > > pango_get_width:5039): Gtk-WARNING **: cannot open display: and that > is the > > reason I'm not getting the output back. Did you all have an issue > like this > > with GTK 1 ? > > > > Thanks *heaps* again ... Z > > > > Example:: > > > > ./pango/pango_get_width "arial 12" "bumpylove" input gives 1 output > > > > Line:0 => > > Line:1 => (pango_get_width:5039): Gtk-WARNING **: cannot open display: > > Line:2 => Got fontname 'arial 12' > > Line:3 => Got input text 'bumpylove' > > Got fontname 'arial 12' Got input text 'bumpylove' > > > > ----- Original Message ----- > > From: "Steph" <steph@php.net> > > To: "Zitan Broth" <zitan@mediasculpt.net>; > <php-gtk-general@lists.php.net> > > Sent: Sunday, September 14, 2003 7:58 PM > > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK] GTk Related Question > > > > > > > We don't have PHP bindings for GTK2 yet, and Pango isn't assimilated > > > into GTK1. > > > > > > Try the Python guys (and don't tell anyone I said so ;) > > > > > > ----- Original Message ----- > > > From: "Zitan Broth" <zitan@mediasculpt.net> > > > To: <php-gtk-general@lists.php.net> > > > Sent: Monday, September 15, 2003 8:40 PM > > > Subject: [PHP-GTK] GTk Related Question > > > > > > > > > Greetings PHP-GTK Crew, > > > > > > This question does not related directly to the php-gtk project, but > I am > > > hoping that you all wont mind and will perhaps be able to offer some > > > advice, it would be greatly appreciated. > > > > > > I have some c code which accesses Pango to find out what the width > is of > > > a given string with font and font size. Works well when called from > the > > > command line. When I call this program from PHP (with exec) it > works, > > > but the output array contains no data from after the points I > initialise > > > a GTK object ( e.g. gtk_init(&argc, &argv); ). It seems wasteful to > > > write the output from the program to file, when I should be able to > pipe > > > it directly into PHP, and I just thought that as Pango is part of > GTK > > > you guys might have an idea about what is causing the problem .... > > > > > > I've included the code just for fun, it really is a simple problem, > but > > > it is sure causing me a large headache. > > > > > > Thanks to all, > > > Zitan. > > > > > > > > > /* > > > pango_get_width > > > > > > Compile Instructions: > > > > > > gcc `pkg-config --cflags gtk+-2.0` pango_get_width.c \ > > > `pkg-config --libs gtk+-2.0` > > > > > > */ > > > #include <stdio.h> > > > #include <stdlib.h> > > > #include <string.h> > > > #include <gtk/gtk.h> > > > > > > /* Written by Attin Cotteral */ > > > static gint char_width_from_layout (PangoFontDescription *pfd, const > > > gchar *s) > > > { > > > GtkWidget *w; > > > PangoContext *pc; > > > PangoLayout *pl; > > > gint width; > > > > > > w = gtk_label_new(NULL); > > > pc = gtk_widget_get_pango_context(w); > > > pango_context_set_font_description(pc, pfd); > > > > > > pl = pango_layout_new(pc); > > > pango_layout_set_text(pl, s, -1); > > > pango_layout_get_pixel_size(pl, &width, NULL); > > > > > > g_object_unref(G_OBJECT(pl)); > > > g_object_unref(G_OBJECT(pc)); > > > gtk_widget_destroy(w); > > > > > > return width; > > > } > > > > > > int main (int argc, char *argv[]) > > > { > > > gint i, width; > > > gchar fontname[128]; > > > gchar inputtext[255]; > > > gchar width_output[255]; > > > > > > PangoFontDescription *pfd; > > > > > > if (argc < 2) { > > > fprintf(stderr, "%s: error fontname < 128 chars\n",argv[0]); > > > exit(EXIT_FAILURE); > > > } > > > > > > *fontname = 0; > > > > > > strcpy(fontname, argv[1]); > > > strcpy(inputtext, argv[2]); > > > i = 2; > > > printf("Got fontname '%s', %d\n", fontname,i); > > > > > > gtk_init(&argc, &argv); > > > // why after calling this command PHP stops getting output? Have > > > tested by putting printf statements before and after init call > > > > > > pfd = pango_font_description_from_string(fontname); > > > > > > width = char_width_from_layout(pfd, inputtext); > > > > > > /* Never get this output */ > > > printf("Got char width of %d\n", width); > > > return 0; > > > } > > > > > > -- > > > PHP-GTK General Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > > > > > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK General Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 - please test build - Instructions to
email.body:
Its' probably 1-2 months old .. off the php-gtk tree.
I just got most of the overrides to build + defaults implemented (using a seperate ini file).
codes on devel.akbkhome.com
I think we need to get this into CVS.. - I'll see if I can set up a branch later today on cvs.php.net for it..
Regards Alan
Frank M. Kromann wrote:
>Hi Alan, > >I'm trying to configure a build environment to build this on Win32 but I >noticed that the include and lib paths in the .dsp files are pointing to >php4 and not to php5. With the current CVS version pg php-gtk this should >be fixed. When did you get these files ? > >I get a lot of warnings and errors at this time. Some are related to Zend >and some to TSRMLS_*, but I'll ee if I can fix them. > >- Frank > > > >>GTK2 Full Status - And Instructions for helping out... >> >> >>At present, PHP-GTK for Gtk2 is a working extension to some degree.... >>On the +ve side: >>- It should build against current CVS of PHP5 (eg. php-src HEAD) >>- It has 1400 functions/methods auto generated from the defs file. >> (gtk1 has 1000) >>- It runs a slightly modified hello.php & fires up gtk.php from tests. >> >>I have just added the base code for callbacks aka >> >> >$obj->connect($signal...) > > >>Next on the TODO list: >>- argumemnt parsing: - when the connect callsback, it sends argments via >> >> > > > >>g_closure_marshal. - these need converting into php variables.. - this >>is one of the biger changes in gtk1/gt2 - and alot of the code in >>main/gtk_object.c needs modifying to fix this.. >>- more testing.. - and understaning of marshalling .. - at present it >>appears to work.. - although it definatly needs more attention (eg. >>making sure it's not leaking memory somewhere..) >>- GObject.. - more support for GObject in the base code.. - all Gdk & >>Gtk objects are based off of GObject now.. - so It should be alot >>simpler to wrap some of the simpler objects that used to be structs.. >> >>---------- BIG JOB - that anyone can help out with -------------- >> >>As you can guess Gtk has a huge number of widgets and methods. >> >>The php-Gtk build process is based around automatically building the >>bindings from the C header files. - however, you can see in the gtk1 >>bindings that the gtk.overrides file modifies the default behaviour for >> >> > > > >>a large number of widgets.. >> >>A simple example of this is GtkButton.. - the standard C code to create >> >> > > > >>button is >>gtk_button_new(); >> - this is the default constructor for the widget (NOTE THAT THERE ARE >> >> > > > >>NO ARGUMENTS), and is autogenerated as >> >>----------------------------- >>PHP_FUNCTION(gtk_button_new) >>{ >> GtkObject *wrapped_obj; >> >> NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); >> >> if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "")) { >> php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); >> return; >> } >> >> wrapped_obj = (GtkObject *)gtk_button_new(); >> if (!wrapped_obj) { >> php_error(E_WARNING, "%s(): could not create GtkButton >> >> > > > >>object", >> get_active_function_name(TSRMLS_C)); >> php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); >> return; >> } >> >> php_gtk_object_init(wrapped_obj, this_ptr); >> >>} >>----------------------------- >> >>However in gtk1 - you are able to send a parameter like >>$x = new GtkButton('the label'); >> >>so the gtk_button_new code is defined in gtk.overrides as: >>------------------------------------- >>PHP_FUNCTION(gtk_button_new) >>{ >> GtkObject *wrapped_obj; >> gchar *text = NULL; >>#ifdef PHP_WIN32 >> gchar *utf8_text = NULL; >>#endif >> >> NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); >> >> if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "|s", &text)) { >> php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); >> return; >> } >> >> if (text) { >>#ifdef PHP_WIN32 >> utf8_text = g_convert(text, strlen(text), "UTF-8", >>GTK_G(codepage), NULL, NULL, NULL); >> wrapped_obj = (GtkObject >>*)gtk_button_new_with_label(utf8_text); >> if (utf8_text) g_free(utf8_text); >>#else >> wrapped_obj = (GtkObject >> >> >*)gtk_button_new_with_label(text); > > >>#endif >> } >> else >> wrapped_obj = (GtkObject *)gtk_button_new(); >> >> if (!wrapped_obj) { >> php_error(E_WARNING, "%s(): could not create GtkButton >> >> > > > >>object", >> get_active_function_name(TSRMLS_C)); >> php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); >> return; >> } >> >> php_gtk_object_init(wrapped_obj, this_ptr); >>} >> >>------------------------------------- >> >> >>Notice (apart from the windows #ifdefs - there is very little different >> >> > > > >>abou the two.. - the key difference being the reading of arguments.. >>------------------------------------- >>if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "|s", &text)) { >>------------------------------------- >>and wheather or not it calls the method.. >>------------------------------------- >>gtk_button_new_with_label(text) >>or >>gtk_button_new() >>------------------------------------- >> >>WHAT TO DO.... >>If anyone wants to help out.. all they need to do is pick an Object >> >>look in gtk.overrides from current CVS, for all the methods that have >>been overridden for that object..- add the code to the end of the >>gtk.overrides in the new gtk2 version. and see if it builds.. >> >>-- if you can get any or all of the methods for an object to build.. - >>let me know and I will add it to the new overrides file. >> >>The current working code is at.. >>http://devel.akbkhome.com/php-gtk2-0.4.tgz >> >>Let me know if you interested in helping out. >> >>Regards >>Alan >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >>-- >>Can you help out? >>Need Consulting Services or Know of a Job? >>http://www.akbkhome.com >> >>-- >>PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> >> >> > > > > >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 - signals, glade
email.body:
You need to port gtk2 first.. - otherwise the only thing you will be able to do is make it appear.. - no signals or objects will be available.
- Ive been slowly getting gtk2 to build on and off in the evening .. - but its still quite a way from complete..
Regards Alan
Grzegorz Godlewski wrote: > Hello! > > I need working php-gtk2 with glade2 "for yesterday" :) > I've done some work on porting. The result is on: > http://ggodlewski.host.sk/php-gtk-0.5.2.tar.gz > > I've used defs files from pygtk and modified generator. > It's done "quick&dirty way" so defs have to be regenerated (I've removed > non-working functions). All the modifications in main/* and php_gtk+-types.c > should be extended - new classes aren't fully implemented, some > things are just commented. > > It even works... However the signals handling has changed in gtk2 (so > it doesn't work). > Glade2 doesn't work also. It shows message: > > PHP Fatal error: Underlying object missing or of invalid type in ... > Memory Fault > > Could anyone tell me what does it mean? > I would be very grateful if anybody help me fixing this two things. > It's very urgent for me. > > BR

> as my generated objects are in alphabtical order.. > > anyway -- I sense days from hello.php comming up :) > > Regards > Alan > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 - please test build - Instructions to help out.
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 - please test build -
email.body:
Hi Alan,
I'm trying to configure a build environment to build this on Win32 but I noticed that the include and lib paths in the .dsp files are pointing to php4 and not to php5. With the current CVS version pg php-gtk this should be fixed. When did you get these files ?
I get a lot of warnings and errors at this time. Some are related to Zend and some to TSRMLS_*, but I'll ee if I can fix them.
- Frank
> GTK2 Full Status - And Instructions for helping out... > > > At present, PHP-GTK for Gtk2 is a working extension to some degree.... > On the +ve side: > - It should build against current CVS of PHP5 (eg. php-src HEAD) > - It has 1400 functions/methods auto generated from the defs file. > (gtk1 has 1000) > - It runs a slightly modified hello.php & fires up gtk.php from tests. > > I have just added the base code for callbacks aka $obj->connect($signal...) > > > Next on the TODO list: > - argumemnt parsing: - when the connect callsback, it sends argments via
> g_closure_marshal. - these need converting into php variables.. - this > is one of the biger changes in gtk1/gt2 - and alot of the code in > main/gtk_object.c needs modifying to fix this.. > - more testing.. - and understaning of marshalling .. - at present it > appears to work.. - although it definatly needs more attention (eg. > making sure it's not leaking memory somewhere..) > - GObject.. - more support for GObject in the base code.. - all Gdk & > Gtk objects are based off of GObject now.. - so It should be alot > simpler to wrap some of the simpler objects that used to be structs.. > > ---------- BIG JOB - that anyone can help out with -------------- > > As you can guess Gtk has a huge number of widgets and methods. > > The php-Gtk build process is based around automatically building the > bindings from the C header files. - however, you can see in the gtk1 > bindings that the gtk.overrides file modifies the default behaviour for
> a large number of widgets.. > > A simple example of this is GtkButton.. - the standard C code to create
> button is > gtk_button_new(); > - this is the default constructor for the widget (NOTE THAT THERE ARE
> NO ARGUMENTS), and is autogenerated as > > ----------------------------- > PHP_FUNCTION(gtk_button_new) > { > GtkObject *wrapped_obj; > > NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > > if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "")) { > php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); > return; > } > > wrapped_obj = (GtkObject *)gtk_button_new(); > if (!wrapped_obj) { > php_error(E_WARNING, "%s(): could not create GtkButton
> object", > get_active_function_name(TSRMLS_C)); > php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); > return; > } > > php_gtk_object_init(wrapped_obj, this_ptr); > > } > ----------------------------- > > However in gtk1 - you are able to send a parameter like > $x = new GtkButton('the label'); > > so the gtk_button_new code is defined in gtk.overrides as: > ------------------------------------- > PHP_FUNCTION(gtk_button_new) > { > GtkObject *wrapped_obj; > gchar *text = NULL; > #ifdef PHP_WIN32 > gchar *utf8_text = NULL; > #endif > > NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > > if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "|s", &text)) { > php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); > return; > } > > if (text) { > #ifdef PHP_WIN32 > utf8_text = g_convert(text, strlen(text), "UTF-8", > GTK_G(codepage), NULL, NULL, NULL); > wrapped_obj = (GtkObject > *)gtk_button_new_with_label(utf8_text); > if (utf8_text) g_free(utf8_text); > #else > wrapped_obj = (GtkObject *)gtk_button_new_with_label(text); > #endif > } > else > wrapped_obj = (GtkObject *)gtk_button_new(); > > if (!wrapped_obj) { > php_error(E_WARNING, "%s(): could not create GtkButton
> object", > get_active_function_name(TSRMLS_C)); > php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); > return; > } > > php_gtk_object_init(wrapped_obj, this_ptr); > } > > ------------------------------------- > > > Notice (apart from the windows #ifdefs - there is very little different
> abou the two.. - the key difference being the reading of arguments.. > ------------------------------------- > if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "|s", &text)) { > ------------------------------------- > and wheather or not it calls the method.. > ------------------------------------- > gtk_button_new_with_label(text) > or > gtk_button_new() > ------------------------------------- > > WHAT TO DO.... > If anyone wants to help out.. all they need to do is pick an Object > > look in gtk.overrides from current CVS, for all the methods that have > been overridden for that object..- add the code to the end of the > gtk.overrides in the new gtk2 version. and see if it builds.. > > -- if you can get any or all of the methods for an object to build.. - > let me know and I will add it to the new overrides file. > > The current working code is at.. > http://devel.akbkhome.com/php-gtk2-0.4.tgz > > Let me know if you interested in helping out. > > Regards > Alan > > > > > > > > > > > -- > Can you help out? > Need Consulting Services or Know of a Job? > http://www.akbkhome.com > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 - please test build - Instructions to help out.
email.body:
On Tue, 30 Sep 2003, Alan Knowles wrote: > Its' probably 1-2 months old .. off the php-gtk tree. > > I just got most of the overrides to build + defaults implemented (using > a seperate ini file). > > codes on devel.akbkhome.com > > I think we need to get this into CVS.. - I'll see if I can set up a > branch later today on cvs.php.net for it..
Alan,
Gtk2 may require a bit of a different approach in the way objects are constructed and so on. Doing it straight on, similar to Gtk1 won't let us take advantage of optimizations and extendibility features. I plan to sit down and write up a plan of attack before PHP Con..
-Andrei
I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by. -- Douglas Adams
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

With PHP5 you can't run php-gtk 0.5.2 or slower you need the CVS source,this source is in ZE2_PORT php-gtk.
And in http://gtk.php.net the last version of PHP-GTK is 0.5.2 this is the last and stable version.

Now when i tried to compile my program modifying my php.ini to point to my extension dir(extension_dir = "c:\pp\extensions\") and used the following command
cd c:\pp php -q -c c:\pp\test\hello.php
and the result was: Error Parsing c:\pp\test\hello.php on line 4
And actually this "hello.php" was none written by me but something which came with php-gtk package and my examination has revealed no error with it.

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #24506 [Opn->Bgs]: Unable to load php_gtk.dll
email.body:
ID: 24506 Updated by: sfox@php.net Reported By: sun4php at coolguide dot net -Status: Open +Status: Bogus Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Operating System: Windows PHP Version: 5.0.0b1 (beta1) New Comment:
Thank you for taking the time to write to us, but this is not a bug. Please double-check the documentation available at http://www.php.net/manual/ and the instructions on how to report a bug at http://bugs.php.net/how-to-report.php
As 'epplestun' said, ZE2 (PHP5) is quite a different animal from ZE1 (PHP4. The current stable PHP-GTK version (0.5.2) should be used on win32 for the time being, as there is no ZE2_PORT binary for Windows just yet.
Cutting edge, eh? ;)
Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------

With PHP5 you can't run php-gtk 0.5.2 or slower you need the CVS source,this source is in ZE2_PORT php-gtk.

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Can't do a fetch from CVS.
email.body:
Hello everyone,
I am trying to use Tortoise-CVS client (on Windows 2000 Pro) to do a fetch from the repository, as described at http://gtk.php.net/download.php.
I get the error message:
" In C:\php-gtk\from_cvs: cvs checkout -P . CVSROOT=:pserver:cvs -d :pserver:cvsread@cvs.php.net:/repository co php-gtk
cvs [checkout aborted]: /repository co php-gtk: no such repository
Error, CVS operation failed "
Can anyone please offer me a clue about what I am doing wrong?
Regards, Colin.

email.body:
Colin Coates wrote: > Dear All, > > Is there a coordinated effort to produce PHP bindings for GTK2 at the > moment?
Not really.. - the main focus (Mainly by Andrei) was getting the code to work with PHP5, which seems to be working now.
I've got some of the core work done for GTK2 bindings: - updated configure - new defs files - modified gtk_types however still outstanding are - main/gtk_object* -- changing all the automated arg handling which uses gtkobject at present to gobject. .. then whatever else stops it building....
But it's an on and off project.. - like when I have time/feel in the mood etc. :)
It's all sitting on a portable here.. - if anyone wants access I can stick it in a subversion folder and open access to it.
Regards Alan

> Not really.. - the main focus (Mainly by Andrei) was getting > the code to > work with PHP5, which seems to be working now.
That's good.
> I've got some of the core work done for GTK2 bindings: <snip!> > then whatever else stops it building.... > > But it's an on and off project.. - like when I have time/feel in the > mood etc. :) > > It's all sitting on a portable here.. - if anyone wants access I can > stick it in a subversion folder and open access to it.
Well, the reason I am interested is because I have written a large project in PHP (for requirements trace ability). Originally, it was going to be a web application; subsequently, people have decided they don't like the web page interface and want a proper GUI. I am hoping to use Glade, libglade and PHP-GTK to 'quickly' produce a front-end for my PHP/MySQL backend code.
To make things more interesting still: it needs to run on Microsoft Windows (2000). I am only working here for another 3 days (although I may subsequently continue working on it part-time).
Anyway, I am interested in your (presumably PHP4) code for GTK2; please could you make it available?
Presumably, mainstream (Andrei's :-) php-gtk development will be PHP5 coded GTK2 bindings?
Thanks for your swift reply! Colin.

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Double click on CList
[PHP-GTK-DEV] gdkpixbuf on win32 (revisited)
email.body:
Using gdkpixbuf libs & headers from http://www.dropline.net/gtk/support.php got me to a slightly different place than before - I can't even build the .dll now :-(
However it's worth noticing where it fails (and would fail to work even if the external symbols were found). There are NO 'render' methods in GTK2's version of pixbuf. RGBDither is a thing of the past :)
--------------------Configuration: gdkpixbuf - Win32 Release_TS-------------------- Performing Custom Build Step on .\gdkpixbuf.defs Loading cache "ext\gdkpixbuf\gdkpixbuf.defs.cache" Loading cache "ext\gtk+\gtk.defs.cache" Could not write function gdk_pixbuf_new_from_xpm_data (parameter type const-char**) Could not write function gdk_pixbuf_animation_new_from_file (return type GdkPixbufAnimation*) Could not write method GdkPixbuf::set_last_unref_handler (parameter type GdkPixbufLastUnref) Could not write method GdkPixbuf::render_to_drawable (parameter type GdkRgbDither) Could not write method GdkPixbuf::render_to_drawable_alpha (parameter type GdkRgbDither) Could not write method GdkPixbuf::render_pixmap_and_mask (parameter type GdkPixmap**) Compiling... gen_gdkpixbuf.c php_gdkpixbuf.c Linking... Creating library Release_TS/php_gtk_gdkpixbuf.lib and object Release_TS/php_gtk_gdkpixbuf.exp gen_gdkpixbuf.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol _php_gtk_get_simple_enum_value gen_gdkpixbuf.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol _php_gtk_set_object php_gdkpixbuf.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol _php_gtk_set_object php_gdkpixbuf.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol _php_gtk_type_hash ../../win32/Release_TS/php_gtk_gdkpixbuf.dll : fatal error LNK1120: 3 unresolved externals Error executing link.exe.

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] this should be sooooooooo simple..
email.body:
I finally got around to trying to build the ze2port on doze tonight. PHP-GTK hot out of CVS, PHP5/ZE2 about a week old, this combination should work on *nix as far as I'm aware, please say if not.
I'm getting 12 fatal errors and 38 warnings, most of which appear to be a direct consequence of:
..\..\ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.h(60) : error C2065: 'tsrm_ls' : undeclared identifier (in fact this constitutes 9 of the errors.)
The other 3 fatals are: C:\php\php-gtk\ext\gtk+\php_gtk+_types.c(1273) : error C2198: 'add_property_long_ex' : too few actual parameters C:\php\php-gtk\ext\gtk+\php_gtk+_types.c(1276) : error C2198: 'add_property_string_ex' : too few actual parameters C:\php\php-gtk\ext\gtk+\php_gtk+_types.c(1278) : error C2198: 'add_property_null_ex' : too few actual parameters
- again these stem from TSRMLS_D/C/whatever being basically screwed, and the vast majority of the warnings are close relatives.
I tried sticking extra Zend-ish defines in the .dsp, it complained - so the paths are fine, I can't see a single reason tsrm_ls should suddenly be meaningless, though obviously there is one :)
Anyone feel like being a hero today?
NB if it helps any, static inline definitions seem to be where it all falls apart..
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] hi
email.body:
Hi there,
My name is Dave, and no ya don't know me, but I wanna tell ya about = something. I'll admit I got your info off a website somewhere while searching = around for addys on Yahoo, but this isn't spam, and i'm not adding you to any sort of list. This email is between *me* and *you* and if you reply, you will get a real person on the other end :-)
The site that I saw yer addy on, and I can't really recall where I saw = it, it had something to do with message forums and online conversation, and = I am also into message forums also. I don't like the flame forums tho with all the idiots just swearing like they have nothing better to do.
I like the ones that are fun, friendly, and the people actually have = something intelligent to say.
Well, anywayz, I run a message forum network called Xpresit Net, and am = trying to premote it. We don't sell anything, and I actually run the network = from my DSL line at home. The site is on an OC3, but the actual mail exchange = takes place from the hub on my DSL line.
This is a network in light of the fact that we not only offer it to = regular people, but we also offer it to websites to have for their visitors.
It's a free speech network, we just don't allow flaming, because I feel = that any opinion can be said without attacking someone.
We have 62 servers so far, and we have telnet, web, nntp (Newsgroup), = and email list access to post in the network.
Since this network is privately run, there is absolutely no spam, and = the way it is setup, spammers can't get to it.
You can't spam via a bot on the website, with telnet its impossible to = spam, and with email and nntp, if anyone actually manages to send out a spam message, their account will be blocked and removed.
I setup this network 10 years ago, starting on my 14.4 modem, if you can beleive that :-)
Well anyways, if you are a webmaster who wants the network on your site, or if your just a regular person looking for a friendly place to chat with some nice people, then please visit http://www.xpresit.net
If you have any questions, please feel free to reply. If your not interested, I'm really really sorry to have bothered you, and you can just delete this email.
Well anywayz, thats about all i have to say about that. I hope you'll join us. But if not thats ok too.
Have a good one, and thanks again.
Dave

email.body:
I've found explain for my question
(parameter (type-and-name GdkDrawable* drawable)(null-ok)(default "NULL"))
Thanks. Best Regards. Angel Maza.
-----Mensaje original----- De: Angel Maza [mailto:amaza@samca.com] Enviado el: martes, 06 de mayo de 2003 17:08 Para: php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net Asunto: [PHP-GTK-DEV] RV: Using GtkExtra under phpgtk
I have send this to the general list, excuse me...
-----Mensaje original----- De: Angel Maza Enviado el: martes, 06 de mayo de 2003 8:58 Para: php-gtk-general@lists.php.net Asunto: Using GtkExtra under phpgtk
I'm starting to create plot.defs for making a GtkPlot/Canvas class...
;; -*- scheme -*- ; object definitions ...
(object Plot (in-module Gtk) (parent Widget (Gtk)) (c-name GtkPlot) ) (object Canvas (in-module Gtk) (parent Widget (Gtk)) (c-name GtkCanvas) )
(function gtk_plot_canvas_new (c-name gtk_plot_canvas_new) (is-constructor-of GtkCanvas) (return-type GtkWidget*) (parameter (type-and-name gint width)) (parameter (type-and-name gint height)) (parameter (type-and-name gdouble magnification))
) (function gtk_plot_new_with_size (c-name gtk_plot_new_with_size) (is-constructor-of GtkPlot) (return-type GtkWidget*) (parameter (type-and-name GdkDrawable* drawable)) (parameter (type-and-name gdouble width)) (parameter (type-and-name gdouble height)) )
With the canvas all is ok, I draw it in the window. But with plot I have the next problem. In C, gtk_plot_new_with_size is called using a NULL as GdkDrawable, but in PHP I can't send it a Null, it claims a GtkDrawable widget.
Best Regards. Angel Maza.

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ZE2 Port bugs
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] How to make bindings for a wiget written in C
email.body:
In general:
go into the php-gtk/ext directory
run ./ext_skel --widget=mygtkwidget this will make the basic build structure. run ../generator/h2def.py /usr/include/mygtkwidget/mygtkwidget.h > mygtkwidget/mygtkwidget.defs and ad dthe line (is-constructor-of mygtkwidget)
in the definition of gtk_mygtkwidget_new
.. have a go building it.. - then slowly work out what you need to add to mygtkwidget.overrides to make it work..
Regards Alan
klaus wrote:
>I would like to know the procedure to make widgets written in C into PHP-GTK >usable widget. > >Thanks, > >Klaus > > > > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] How to make bindings for a wiget written in C
email.body:
Hi, you can use the ext_skel script tu build you own widgets:
./ext_skel --widget=name
This creates yor .defs .overrides .h and .c, then you edit this files and thisis all. You can see combobutton widget to start is very easy :-)
El lun, 12-05-2003 a las 13:14, klaus escribió: > I would like to know the procedure to make widgets written in C into PHP-GTK > usable widget. > > Thanks, > > Klaus > > > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] well, I cheated to make it build so I should expect this...
email.body:
(pixbuf.php:4294570651): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: gtype.c:1806:g_type_register_static(): initialization assertion failed, use g_type_init() prior to this function
(pixbuf.php:4294570651): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: file gobject.c: line 585 (g_object_new): assertion `G_TYPE_IS_OBJECT (object_type)' failed C:\php4\test\pixbuf.php has been running
All I've done is added in Frank's changes from an earlier private exchange, added the 4 remaining guilty parties:
gdk_pixbuf_get_from_drawable gdk_pixbuf_finalize gdk_pixbuf_render_threshold_alpha gdk_pixbuf_render_pixmap_and_mask
to 'ignore' in overrides, and PHP_GTK_API'd gdk_window_new() in both the files that happens in (because it's also a drawable). I should add that the baby .dll doesn't 'see' anything in the system path and is demanding that everything (down to and including the relevant jpeg.dll and png.dll) be right there next to it before it stops complaining about existing at all, I know not why.
I don't have any working gdkpixbuf scripts - if anyone with nix has a simple one that works on their box, it'd be good to see it now - so I just tried to create a new pixbuf object in a window (which may be wrong in itself, but I suspect that isn't the problem somehow).
Clues, anyone?
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] gtkcanvas - first go...
email.body:
Just had a quick play to see if I could get gtkcanvas (the downport of gnomecanvas) to work.. it's more of a managed drawing tool - so you can group lines together, drag them around and stuff.. http://laguna.fmedic.unam.mx/~daniel/glogo/compare.html
it 'should' be possible to get this to work on windows..
anyway the codes at http://www.akbkhome.com:81/svn/gtk_widgets/canvas/
just stuffit in the ext directory of php-gtk do rm buildmk.stamp ; ./buildconf ./configure --enable-scintilla --enable-pixbuf \ --enable-gtkhtml --enable-canvas
and it should build...
now I've got to work out which bits of the api actually work!! :)
NOTE this is built using a php port of h2def.py - which seems to work alot better.. - http://www.akbkhome.com:81/svn/akpear/PHP_CGenerator/h2def.php
Regards Alan

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] gtkextra - first attemp...
email.body:
can you follow the skeleton config.m4, so it searches for extra.h in the right place? for x in /usr /usr/local; do if test -f $x/include/gtkextra/gtkextra.h; then EXTRA_DIR=$x
EXTRA_INCDIR=$x/include/gtkextragtk_plotdata_newgtk_plotdata_newgtk_plotdata_newgtk_plotdata_new fi done
if test -z "$EXTRA_DIR"; then AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot locate extra) fi
EXTRA_LIBDIR=$EXTRA_DIR/lib
Also
you have gtk_plotdata_new which should be gtk_plot_data_new
after that was changed, plot.php works very nicely :)
--
Regards Alan
P.S. Andrei - did you want extra and canvas in CVS?
Angel Maza wrote: > Sorry, no attachments allowed... > > http://www.pyrena.com/phpgtk/extra.tgz > > > > -----Mensaje original----- > De: Angel Maza [mailto:amaza@samca.com] > Enviado el: lunes, 26 de mayo de 2003 11:33 > Para: php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net > Asunto: [PHP-GTK-DEV] gtkextra - first attemp... > > This is a first attemp to get working gtkextra. > > There is a simple test : php -q plot.php > > ./configure --enable-extra > > Best Regards. > Angel Maza. > > >

email.body:
http://talks.php.net/show/kongress-gtk-csg/20 here you have a good script to test gdkpixbuf :-) ----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph" <sfox@php.net> To: "Frank M. Kromann" <frank@kromann.info> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Tuesday, May 20, 2003 6:02 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] well, I cheated to make it build so I should expect this...
> (pixbuf.php:4294570651): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: > gtype.c:1806:g_type_register_static(): initialization assertion failed, > use g_type_init() prior to this function > > (pixbuf.php:4294570651): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: file gobject.c: line > 585 (g_object_new): assertion `G_TYPE_IS_OBJECT (object_type)' failed > C:\php4\test\pixbuf.php has been running > > All I've done is added in Frank's changes from an earlier private > exchange, added the 4 remaining guilty parties: > > gdk_pixbuf_get_from_drawable > gdk_pixbuf_finalize > gdk_pixbuf_render_threshold_alpha > gdk_pixbuf_render_pixmap_and_mask > > to 'ignore' in overrides, and PHP_GTK_API'd gdk_window_new() in both the > files that happens in (because it's also a drawable). I should add that > the baby .dll doesn't 'see' anything in the system path and is demanding > that everything (down to and including the relevant jpeg.dll and > png.dll) be right there next to it before it stops complaining about > existing at all, I know not why. > > I don't have any working gdkpixbuf scripts - if anyone with nix has a > simple one that works on their box, it'd be good to see it now - so I > just tried to create a new pixbuf object in a window (which may be wrong > in itself, but I suspect that isn't the problem somehow). > > Clues, anyone? > > - Steph > > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
